issues.description: The problem statement's UML and task description specify addGuestStudents(int) as returning void, but the solution implementation declares addGuestStudents(int) returning boolean. This mismatch in the method return type can confuse students about the expected signature and behavior (e.g., whether they should return a success flag) and may cause automated checks or comparisons against the reference solution to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's addGuestStudents method signature match the problem specification and UML. Change the solution method to public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) and perform any input validation internally (e.g., ignore negative inputs or throw an IllegalArgumentException) without changing the return type. Alternatively, if returning a boolean is intentional, update the problem statement and UML to indicate addGuestStudents(int): boolean and document the meaning of the return value.
